Abdominal ventrites with transverse sulci (Fig. 44B). (Prosopogmus)
Hind angles of pronotum without obvious jag at the level of the basal seta (Fig. 45A)
Hind angles of pronotum with obvious jag at the level of the basal seta (Fig. 45B)

Pronotum with base bordered from near hind angle to level of inner basal impression
Elytral striae distinctly crenulate, but not deeply punctate, surface with purple reflex
Elytral striae not crenulate, not or shallowly punctate, surface black, slightly iridescent
Pronotum with outer basal impression
Pronotum without outer basal impression
Angular base of stria one present, pronotum with outer basal impression well impressed or at least shallowly marked with a convex region laterally
Angular base of stria one absent, pronotum without outer basal impression, not convex laterad impression
Elytral epipleura and most of the ventral surface with short scattered pubescent
Elytral epipleura glabrous, ventral surface glabrous except for the typical arrangement of a few long setae on various segments
Head contrastingly shinier than relatively dull pronotum and elytra (Figs 17, 31). Elytral interval 7 sharply carinate from humerus to level of plica

Dorsal luster various. Elytral interval 7 not raised above the level of other intervals OR raised (sharply carinate or notably raised and rounded) only in the basal half of the elytra and apically not raised or only very slightly more pronounced than other intervals at that level. In some Abacophrastus that have a relatively raised interval 7, the dorsal surface luster is shiny throughout and the head is not contrastingly duller (Fig. 30)
Elytral interval 5 neither carinate nor raised, prosternal process glabrous
Elytral interval 5 sharply carinate, or noticeably raised in the apical third (Fig. 46), prosternal process with seta at apex (Abacoleptus
Elytral interval 5 sharply carinate in apical third, body-form relatively narrow and elongate (Figs 17A, B), base of pronotum slightly wider than base of elytra
Elytral interval 5 raised and rounded in apical third, body-form relatively broad (Fig. 17C), base of pronotum equal to width of elytra base
Elytral interval 6 ended well before apex of 7, intervals 5 and 7 conjoined or separate
Elytral interval 6 ended slightly beyond apex of 7, intervals 5 and 7 separate
Setae present at or near the pronotal hind angles; elytra without punctures in interval 3
Setae lacking at pronotal hind angle; elytra with one or more setigerous punctures in interval 3
Cerabilia spp (Loxandrini, ~24 sp. n. to be treated elsewhere)
Prosternal process glabrous
Prosternal process with seta at apex (Abacomorphus)
Body-length 20mm or more, entirely black dorsally or rarely with a slight hint of a metallic reflex
Body-length 15-20mm, dorsally black with vividly purple, blue or green metallic luster or at least with a notable metallic reflex
Tarsi dorsally glabrous
Tarsi dorsally with fine, sparse setae (Abacophrastus)
Base of elytra with complete raised margin
Base of elytra raised margin broadly interrupted at stria 6
Anterior face of mesotibia near ventral edge with two setate
Anterior face of mesotibia near ventral edge with row of five to seven setate
Eye moderate sized, dorso-ventral width of eye 1.5-1.8x width of gena below eye
Eyes very large, dorso-ventral width of eye 2.5x width of gena below eye
Elytral striae complete and well impressed throughout their length. Elytral humeri prominent, angulate with sharp outward turned denticle
Elytral striae shallowly impressed in apical third, 6th strae basally and 7th stria medially very shallow. Elytral humeri prominent and angulate but denticle bluntly rounded
Size large, length 13mm or more. Antennae long, antennomeres 5-10 elongate, length about 3x width
Size small, length 10mm or less. Antennae short, antennomeres 5-10 stout, length about 2x width
With convex 10th interval at level of plica and 3-4 apical setigerous punctures in 9th interval
With convex 10th interval at level of plica and 3-4 apical setigerous punctures in 9th interval
Frons smooth; elytral interval 7 rounded and slightly raised near humerus; body form moderately narrow (Figs 36, 37, 40)
Frons rugose; elytral interval 7 sharply carinate near humerus; very broad body form (Fig. 34)
Head, pronotum and elytra similarly shiny; elytra slightly iridescent (Setalidius)
Head and pronotum contrastingly shinier than dull elytra (Sphodrosomus)
Elytral intervals 4-5 notably convex and arcuate onto the elytral base, clypeo-ocular sulci scarcely impressed
Elytral intervals 4-5 slightly convex and straight onto the elytral base, clypeo-ocular sulci elongate, impressed and divergent
Body-length 21mm or larger, antennae very long, antennomere 5 length five times its width
Body-length under 14mm, antennae of average length, antennomere 5 length three times its width
Anterior face of profemur with one medial and one basal seta; elytral dorsal surface scarcely papillose, relatively smooth in dorso-medial third

Anterior face of profemur with more than two setae, in most individuals arranged as a longitudinal row of 4-10 setae and cluster of 2-4 basal setae; elytral dorsal surface clearly and uniformly papillose throughout

caption.p: Ventral view, Darodilia undetermined species from New Caledonia showing A longitudinally strigose proepisternum B transverse sulci of abdominal sterna.
Right hind angle of pronotum showing A prominent jag in Prosopogmus lescheni B obtusely rounded angle in Prosopogmus koghisensis.

Apical portion of elytra showing A Abacoleptus carinatus with interval 6 ended well before apex of 7 B Abacoleptus paradoxus with interval 6 ended beyond apex of interval 7. Intervals are numbered and the arrows indicate the end of interval 6.
